conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to identify how liquid flows through the system, follow the flow paths, and determine which container is connected to the outlets.

The image shows a system with four outlets labeled A, B, C, and D. Liquid flows from these outlets into a series of baffles connected to two containers labeled E and F. The flow paths from each outlet are distinct, and the connections to containers E and F are clearly indicated.
The image shows four outlets labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the system.
The image shows two containers labeled E and F at the bottom of the system.
The image shows baffles connecting the outlets to the containers.
Liquid flowing from outlets A, B, C, and D will travel through the system.
Liquid from outlet A flows to a baffle and then into a container.
Liquid from outlet B flows to another baffle and then into a container.
Liquid from outlet C flows to a different baffle and then into a container.
Liquid from outlet D flows to yet another baffle and then into a container.
Outlet D connects to container F.
Outlet C connects to container F.
Outlet A connects to container E.
Outlet B connects to container E.
Given that liquid from outlets C and D both flow into container F, container F will receive liquid from these outlets.
The predicted container for liquid flow is F.
